snippet: The nation’s Roman Catholic bishops voted unanimously Tuesday to support the cause of sainthood for Dorothy Day, who helped to found the Catholic Worker movement.
abstract: Roman Catholic bishops vote unanimously to support cause of sainthood for Dorothy Day, Catholic convert and advocate for the poor who helped to found the Catholic Worker movement and to advance the church’s teaching on social justice.
lead_paragraph: The nation’s Roman Catholic bishops voted unanimously Tuesday to support the cause of sainthood for Dorothy Day, who helped to found the Catholic Worker movement.

headline.main: Bishops Support Dorothy Day for Sainthood
headline.print_headline: Bishops Support Dorothy Day For Sainthood
